intro: Calixnos trinervius, commonly known as the three-veined calix, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Calixnos trinervius is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
